newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL palm oil ends down, weak ringgit limits fall.
newsitem.headline: KL palm oil ends down, weak ringgit limits fall.

text.p: PALM OIL FUTURES PALM OIL PHYSICALS
(3rd pos) 1,154 rgt/tonne July (south) 1,192.50 *
Open/Hi/Low 1,150/1,155/1,147 Prev close 1,195
Prev settlement 1,155 * sellers prices

PALM OIL FUTURES - Extended losses on weak fundamentals and weaker Chicago soyoil futures overnight. Falls limited by a weak ringgit against U.S. dollar. Seen steady unless ringgit strenghtens. Support for Oct futures pegged at 1,140 ringgit.
PALM OIL PHYSICALS - Also recovered from lows on ringgit's fall. Activity again focussed on nearby crude palm oil and RBD palm olein.
The ringgit was at 2.6370 to a dollar at 1000 GMT, against its close of 2.6230 in Kuala Lumpur on Tuesday.
A weak ringgit is seen as a supportive factor for the palm oil export market, which traded mostly in U.S. dollars.
Local palm oil prices were expected to hold steady if the ringgit stayed weak, they said. Immediate support for third position contract is pegged at 1,140 ringgit.
Weak fundamentals and overnight losses in Chicago soyoil futures had pressured prices earlier.
Traders said concern about rising stocks continued to cloud the market. They said production remained robust and offtake was not sufficient to keep stocks from piling up.
Private crop forecaster Ivan Wong has estimated stocks to reach 1.06 million tonnes by end-September. For end-July, he forecast stocks at 865,000-875,000 tonnes.
Official figures from the Palm Oil Registration and Licensing Authority (PORLA) placed stocks at the end of June at 786,123 tonnes.
Total volume on the futures market stood at 1,522 lots.
Physicals July (south) crude palm oil was offered at 1,192.50 ringgit ($452.22) a tonne against bids at 1,185. It was traded from 1,190 to 1,185.
July (central) saw offers at 1,182.50 ringgit against bids at 1,175. It saw trades at 1,177.50 and 1,175.
Aug (south) was offered at 1,192.50 ringgit against bids at 1,187.50. It was traded at 1,190 and 1,187.50.
Aug (central) was offered at 1,182.50 against bids at 1,177.50.
In refined palm oil, Aug RBD palm oil was offered at $482.50 a tonne FOB Malaysia, Sep at $480 and Oct/Nov/Dec also at $480.
Aug RBD palm olein saw offers at $520, Sep at $515 and Oct/Nov/Dec at $512.50. Aug was traded at $517.50 and Oct/Nov/Dec at $510.
Aug RBD palm stearin was offered at $362.50 and Sep at $360. Aug was traded at $360.
Aug/Sep RBD palm fatty acid distillate saw offers at $290.
